thread.title: Qantas profit slides as international competition heats up
thread.title_full: Qantas profit slides as international competition heats up

author: Patrick Hatch
title: Qantas profit slides as international competition heats up
text:
Qantas handed down its half-year results on Thursday. Photo: Glenn Hunt 
Qantas said its international business had been hit by competitors growing capacity by 11 per cent, which lowered its earnings from international flights by almost 9 per cent to $208 million. 
Domestic earnings fell $16 million to $317 million in the half. 
"The international market is tough because of capacity growth and lower fares, and Qantas International is not immune from those pressures," Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce said. 
"But the work we've done on removing costs and making the business more efficient means Qantas International is outperforming its peers in the region." Advertisement 
Mr Joyce said Qantas' focus was to be disciplined on capacity, cut costs and introduce improvements like on-board Wi-Fi and Boeing Dreamliners, due to come into service later this year. 
Qantas' net profit came in at $715 million - down a quarter from the same half last year. That reflected a $201 million gain from the sale of Sydney Airport Terminal Three in the prior corresponding quarter, Qantas said. 
The company will pay out an interim dividend of 7Â¢ a share, 50 per cent franked, on April 10. 
More to come...
